citations.narrative:
A capybara and a Patagonian cavy were injured due to incompatibility with their housing mates. A male capybara was
acquired by the facility and being introduced to the female capybara. An employee let the male capybara out of his
smaller enclosure and he was attacked by the female, causing a wound on his nose, across his back, and to his left hind
limb. On inspection, the wounds on the nose and back were healing, but he was still sore and resisted putting weight on
his left hind limb. He is currently under treatment by the attending veterinarian.
A male Patagonian cavy was acquired to introduce to the two female cavies at the facility. The facility slowly introduced
him and was three-weeks into the process, when the owner suspected he might have some scratches so she separated
him from the females. An employee removed him from his separate enclosure and allowing the females direct access to
him and they killed him.
Animals that are incompatible with one another can cause stress, injury, and death to their counterparts. Correct by
ensuring all animals housed in the same primary enclosure are compatible. Correct by 7 December 2023. The facility took
measures to remove the employees responsible.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
n

narrative:
3.133  Critical
   
Separation. 
A capybara and a Patagonian cavy were injured due to incompatibility with their housing mates. A male capybara was 
acquired by the facility and being introduced to the female capybara. An employee let the male capybara out of his 
smaller enclosure and he was attacked by the female, causing a wound on his nose, across his back, and to his left hind 
limb. On inspection, the wounds on the nose and back were healing, but he was still sore and resisted putting weight on 
his left hind limb. He is currently under treatment by the attending veterinarian.  
A male Patagonian cavy was acquired to introduce to the two female cavies at the facility. The facility slowly introduced 
him and was three-weeks into the process, when the owner suspected he might have some scratches so she separated 
him from the females. An employee removed him from his separate enclosure and allowing the females direct access to 
him and they killed him.  
Animals that are incompatible with one another can cause stress, injury, and death to their counterparts. Correct by 
ensuring all animals housed in the same primary enclosure are compatible. Correct by 7 December 2023. The facility took 
measures to remove the employees responsible. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee. 
 
 n
